statement.p: Each graph below shows the xy-plane as part of 3-space, together with two vectors.

Part 1: Shown below are solid blue vector \displaystyle\vec{{{w}}} and dashed red vector \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}, both drawn on the xy-plane. Decide if the cross product \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}\times\vec{{{w}}} points into the screen, out of the screen, or if it is the zero vector.

ol.li: Neither: It is the zero vector

statement.p: Part 2: Shown below are dashed red vector \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}} and solid blue vector \displaystyle\vec{{{w}}}, both drawn on the xy-plane. Decide if the cross product \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}\times\vec{{{w}}} points into the screen, out of the screen, or if it is the zero vector.

ol.li: Neither: It is the zero vector

statement.p: Part 3: Shown below are dashed blue vector \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}} and solid red vector \displaystyle\vec{{{w}}}, both drawn on the xy-plane. Decide if the cross product \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}\times\vec{{{w}}} points into the screen, out of the screen, or if it is the zero vector.

ol.li: Neither: It is the zero vector

statement.p: Part 4: Shown below are dashed red vector \displaystyle\vec{{{w}}} and solid blue vector \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}, both drawn on the xy-plane. Decide if the cross product \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}\times\vec{{{w}}} points into the screen, out of the screen, or if it is the zero vector.

ol.li: Neither: It is the zero vector

statement.p: Part 5: Shown below are dashed red vector \displaystyle\vec{{{w}}} and solid blue vector \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}, both drawn on the xy-plane. Decide if the cross product \displaystyle\vec{{{u}}}\times\vec{{{w}}} points into the screen, out of the screen, or if it is the zero vector.

ol.li: Neither: It is the zero vector
